title.narrative: Research for Health in Humanitarian Crises Phase III

description.narrative: The aim of this project is to develop more effective responses to humanitarian challenges by providing significant funding for high-quality research on the effectiveness of health interventions in humanitarian crises.

mailing-address.narrative: 1 Saint Johns Lane, London EC1M 4AR, United Kingdom

description.narrative: Collaborative partnerships between biomedical/public health researchers and the humanitarian sector are expanded and enhanced
Number grants awarded to PIs not previously awarded R2HC grants, including non-humanitarian researchers

comment.narrative: to be tracked
9 (6 = Call 6 & 3 = Ebola DRC)

comment.narrative: 8 (4 = Call 6 & 4 = Ebola DRC)

comment.narrative: 8 (5 = Call 6 & 3 = Ebola DRC)

comment.narrative: 6 (5 = Call 6 & 1 = Ebola DRC)

1 in person RIT or Online Course completed per grantee and Majority of current grantees complete SES
Members of 9 study teams registered for online course and partially completed. Anticipating 5-6 SES completed by end of year (many teams uptake planning disrupted due to pandemic).

Plan in place and key 2020 activities delivered with priority stakeholders. Plan activities for 2021
Strategic engagement plan in place. Activities delivered as planned with 2020 in-person activities adjusted to be on-line due to Covid-19, where feasible.

description.narrative: # of key communications outputs published (newsletters, blogs)

comment.narrative: 4 newsletters / year 4 impact newsletters / year 4 publications newsletters / year 4 blogs /year

description.narrative: # of key events R2HC has been engaged with / convened with key stakeholders to disseminate knowlege generated through the Programme.

comment.narrative: . 3 per year MHPSS CoP WASH CoP, SRH IAWG

Many key events postponed due to COVID-19, but on track to achieve in Q4 2020: GHSS abstract accepted Co-convening COVID-19 webinar w/IGHD Queen Margaret's IASC Ref Gp on MHPPS annual meeting Specific work in progress for all other fields

description.narrative: Engagement metrics generated through our Website and Social media.

comment.narrative: to be tracked

The Humanitarian Health Evidence Review = 1,285 pageviews & 194 downloads (plus 107 downloads of executive summary) - Mitigating Operational Challenges in Humanitarian Health Research (published February 2020) = 601 pageviews & 113 downloads - Research Methodologies in Humanitarian Crises Review (published in February 2020) = 1,035 pageviews & 249 downloads - Research Ethics Tool = 2,057 pageviews & 343 downloads - Research portfolio 2019 = 261 pageviews & 76 downloads - Research snapshots ( a collective total for all ) = 279 pageviews & 217 downloads

description.narrative: Knowledge and learning from R2HC-funded research is captured, synthesised and shared through communications & engagement activities

comment.narrative: reports
snapshot
1 research snapshot per completed study
11 research snapshots and 8 more anticipated by end 2020
2 reports ODI Humanitarian Exchange Ebola Special Edition - Review of MHPSS interventions - Synthesis of Ebola 2019 call outputs
5 reports: Operational Challenges report, Research Methodology report, R2HC Partnerships review, ODI Humanitarian Exchange Ebola Special Edition, Review of MHPSS interventions report

description.narrative: # of reviews, guidance products and tools developed to improve quality and effectiveness of public health research and its uptake.

RIT course on-line, Responsive Mechanism Review and Pathways to Impact reviews commissioned; reports due end Q1 2021
